meanings.definition: The quality or state of lacking musical pitch or variation in sound.
meanings.sent1: The tonelessness of the alarm clock made it difficult to wake up in the morning.
meanings.sent2: The singer's tonelessness was evident as she sang the same note repeatedly.
meanings.sent3: The tonelessness of the doorbell made it sound like a broken record.
meanings.sent4: The tonelessness of the wind chimes created a haunting atmosphere in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The tonelessness of the drumbeat gave the song a monotonous rhythm.

meanings.definition: The lack of emotional inflection or expression in speech or writing.
meanings.sent1: Her tonelessness during the presentation made it hard to understand her message.
meanings.sent2: The actor's tonelessness in the play left the audience feeling disconnected.
meanings.sent3: The tonelessness of the robot's voice made it seem like it lacked feelings.
meanings.sent4: The tonelessness of the teacher's voice made the lecture seem never-ending.
meanings.sent5: The tonelessness of the news anchor's delivery made the report seem dull.
